text: <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is tyrosine phosphorylated in response to <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and suppresses <extra_id_0> STAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation and lymphocyte proliferation .

Members of the recently discovered SOCS / CIS / SSI family have been proposed as regulators of cytokine signaling , and while targets and mechanisms have been suggested for some family members , the precise role of these proteins remains to be defined .

To date no SOCS proteins have been specifically implicated in <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) signaling in T cells .

Here we report <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in response to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in both T-cell lines and human peripheral blood lymphocytes .

<extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein was detectable as early as 30 min following <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation , while <extra_id_0> CIS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was seen only at low levels after 2 h . Unlike <extra_id_0> CIS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was rapidly tyrosine phosphorylated in response to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was observed upon coexpression with <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but only weakly with <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In these experiments , <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> associated with <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and inhibited <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation , and this inhibition was markedly enhanced by the presence of <extra_id_0> IL-2 receptor beta chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2Rbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Moreover , following <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation of T cells , <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was able to interact with the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor complex , and in particular tyrosine phosphorylated <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-2Rbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Additionally , in lymphocytes expressing <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but not <extra_id_0> CIS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> STAT5b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was markedly reduced , while there was only a weak effect on <extra_id_0> IL-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated <extra_id_0> STAT5b <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> tyrosine phosphorylation .

Finally , proliferation induced by both <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> IL-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was significantly inhibited in the presence of <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The findings suggest that when <extra_id_0> SOCS-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is rapidly induced by <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in T cells , it acts to inhibit <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responses in a classical negative feedback loop .
